Legal_Issue: Whether the court can order costs in a governance dispute after a settlement agreement
Governing_Law: Federal Courts Act, s. 18(1)(a) and s. 18.1(3)(a)
Evidence_Assessment: Conduct during litigation, reasonableness of claims
Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to justify claim; not met regarding candidacy
Credibility_Factor: Unreasonable pursuit of ineligible claim (Commandant's candidacy)
Legal_Rule: Court may determine authority to hold office and order by-elections but cannot decide candidacy eligibility under Election Regulations
Procedural_Issue: Costs allocation following settlement and dismissal of application
Grounds_for_Claim: Removal of Chief Commandant and councillors, election rule disputes
Outcome_on_Merits: Application dismissed post-settlement; no ruling on merits due to settlement
Review_Standard: Applicable judicial review standards for federal courts
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Both parties contributed equally to inflated litigation costs
Key_Evidence_Considered: Settlement agreement, litigation conduct, eligibility under Election Regulations
Legal_Framework: Federal Courts Act and Election Regulations
Applicant_Challenge: Seeking declarations and orders against Wahta Mohawk Band Council members
Court_Result: Costs awarded due to pursuit of an ineligible claim
Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities, applied to costs assessment
Defendant_Response: Contested costs due to unreasonable claims and conduct
Outcome: Settlement finalized; partial costs awarded; focus on future cooperation
Remedy_Sought: Judicial intervention in governance and election process
Resolution_Mechanism: Settlement agreement followed by court-ordered costs
Authority: Federal Court jurisdiction over governance disputes involving First Nations
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Pursuit of claim barred by Election Regulations (candidacy eligibility)
Outcome_of_Review: Costs granted to respondents on partial basis
Governing_Rule: Federal Courts Act governs authority to decide office-holding; Election Regulations govern candidacy
